description.text:
The 2016 ICT4D Conference is focused on using ICT to accelerate progress toward the Sustainable Development Goals. The conference aims to bring together a cross section of private and civil society organizations to engage with government agencies in a discussion of how ICT plans for their geographic regions might build on the recommendations provided in the Sustainable Development Goals Information and Communications Technology Playbook (SDG ICT Playbook) and benefit from cross-sector partnerships in addressing the 2030 Sustainable Development and Addis Ababa Action Agendas. 


Register for the full conference to receive a 40% discount.  Otherwise register for the days which you can attend.  Note, if you plan to attend at least three days, it is more economical to register for the full conference. 




To qualify for a 30% non-profit discount, you must e-mail proof of your non-profit status to ict4dmail@crs.org . 


For more information visit www.ict4dconference.org.  
Note: Your name and e-mail address will be shared with all other conference participants.

description.text:
Financial empowerment through trusted payment solutions  The flagship event in the AB&MM series, Nairobi attracts participation from throughout the continent, showcasing both local and international innovators and technology suppliers, creating a rich mix of user and vendor case studies and best practice demonstrations in the conference. 
The Challenge African banks have a great challenge in overcoming their heritage of colonial banking systems, which were designed to serve government, corporates and high-worth individuals. The bottom part of the pyramid has been badly neglected, and only recently have commercial banks started addressing this market segment as mobile operators set the pace in providing low-cost banking services. The AITEC Banking & Mobile Money Conference Series plays a valuable role in challenging banks to embark on innovative financial inclusion strategies, through technological innovation, and through the development of a customer-oriented corporate culture and service innovation. 
Who are the conferences aimed at? Each conference has clear target audiences: • ICT managers & professionals in the banking and financial services sector • Policy-makers • High-level managers at CEO, COO and CFO level • Innovators and service providers active in the financial services sector • Telecom operators and service providers • NGOs, civil society organisations and development partners directly involved with delivering banking or microfinance services in rural/under-serviced areas. • Media representatives and analystsMarketing value proposition 
 The AITEC series has an established track record of serving high-quality business events, combining leading-edge conferences with a networking exhibition format, enabling delegates, conference speakers and exhibitors to mix freely and exchange ideas and contacts. Consistently over the eight years that the conference series has been running, exhibitors and sponsors have been delighted with the quality of the audience 
Conference Format The conferences provide valuable educational forums for the financial services sector, updating CXOs, IS directors and their teams on a wide range of latest trends and developments in financial services, including payment technologies, best practices in IT project implementation, and customer service delivery. Bankers are asked to share their insights into optimizing customer service, operations and delivery of banking services.Peer discussions and audience participation are encouraged though panel discussions, forums and workshops in many of the

description.text:
Introduction 
The Center for Intellectual Property and Information Technology Law (CIPIT) at Strathmore Law School, in partnership with the global pharmaceutical companies Pfizer Inc. and Novartis International, is holding an innovation workshop and conference from 24th to 26th May2016 at Strathmore University. The East Africa Innovation Workshop follows in the spirit of the 2015 Global Entrepreneurship Summit and seeks to gather key regional stakeholders in a collaborative environment for fostering innovation. 
Background 
The East African region is experiencing substantial economic and cultural growth, driven in part by a limitless enthusiasm for innovation. While mobile banking products such as MPesa® showcase African innovation and entrepreneurship on a global scale, innovation is active in virtually all sectors. In health-related products, current research is active in new pharmaceutical compounds, natural formulations, medical devices, and new uses of traditional medicines and bioactive compositions. Such R&D is carried out by universities, international research organizations, and private industry, but in some cases is uncoordinated and lacks guidance with respect to issues of Intellectual Property Rights. 
About the workshop 
Workshop participants will engage with regional experts in exploring the innovative knowledge-based economy in East Africa—and help explore ways to accelerate socio-economic growth, local innovation, and foreign direct investment. The primary focus of the workshop is innovation, and a secondary focus is health care. 
The workshop leads off on 24th May with a one-day Intellectual Property Boot Camp, ideal for those looking for a more in-depth understanding of IPR, or a refresher in IP and innovation. Participatory panel discussions, research presentations, and interactive breakout sessions take place on 25-26th May. 
The main themes of the event are: 


Creating an enabling legal, regulatory and policy environment to unlock the social and economic benefits of  innovation in East Africa; 


Addressing the intellectual property education and awareness gap in East Africa—and the lack of enabling infrastructure for local innovators, researchers and entrepreneurs; and 


Reviewing the role of innovation in job/wealth creation – especially for African women and the youth, and especially in the area of healthcare. 


  
The boot camp and workshop are free to attend, but registration is required. We look forward to your attendance! 
Details 
Intellectual Property Rights Boot Camp: 24th May 2016 from 9:00 AM to 4 PM (EAT) 
Innovation Workshop: 25th­–26th May, 2016from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM (EAT)

description.text:
BFMA is established as the continent’s largest annual gathering of thought-leaders from all branches of Africa’s booming creative arts and digital media industry, including innovators and professionals from TV, radio, film, music, mobile tech, telecoms, advertising, animation and gaming. The event has expanded over the years to attract over 50 exhibitors, 120 expert conference speakers and 2,500 delegates in 2015. BFMA gathers senior broadcast executives, producers, advertising agency executives, regulators, academics, regulators and policy-makers, as well as content providers, animators, script-writers, game developers and a host of other creative industry professionals to promote their services, exchange ideas, discuss industry issues and engage in a wide range of networking opportunities. It is an unparalleled industry forum for networking and deal-making across Africa’s dynamic digital media landscape. 
The event will also include a Forum on the African Diaspora Opportunity for the African Entertainment Industry, highlighting the increasing impact of African entertainment content in international marketplaces. The Forum will explore opportunities for collaboration, distribution deals, joint productions and other channels to grow market presence, impact and revenue. 
FILM INDUSTRY CONFERENCE. 
The film industry used to be dependent primarily upon theatrical release to distribute content and television was a secondary market. Now with over a billion smart phones and other devices that can play movies, music videos and a host of other media, filmmakers now have more opportunity than ever to deliver their products to a global market. BFMA brings together filmmakers, television executives, independent producers, new media platform entrepreneurs and others involved in delivering media content. Panel discussions explore film distribution, intellectual property rights, co-production strategies and other topics while the BFMA Preview Cinema showcases African and African-themed films. 
FIL INDUSTRY INVESTMENT FORUM 
The Film Industry Investment Forum will bring together an international and regional audience of film industry investors, investment firms, banks,investment advisors, filmmakers and production companies to deliberate on the investment opportunities within the film industry. The Forum also serves a necessary function of enabling the Kenyan film industry to keep up to date with international broadcast and film trends and funding strategies. 
AFRICAN ADVERTISING SUMMIT 
East Africa has never had a conference focused on the advertising industry. BFMA 2015 will introduce such a conference, bringing a critical component into the conversation about how to enhance the quality and profitability of African entertainment content. It adds value to the conference by bringing new relevant media players, introducing new compelling content and stimulating more interaction between broadcasters, content providers and advertisers. Technology and innovation are impacting every aspect of media and this converged environment poses challenges as well as opportunities for the whole media ecosystem. 
GAMING & ANIMATION PAVILLION 
The Gaming & Animation Pavilion gives Africa’s emerging animators and game developers and startups a place in the expo area to showcase their products in order to attract partners, investors and customers among the extensive international and regional audience attending the event. 
MEDIA TECHNOLOGY EXHIBITION 
More than 100 international vendors of various types of products and services exhibit at the event. You will find everything from cameras, lighting and audio recording equipment, video editing software, satellite broadcast products, cloud storage solutions, digital rights management software, mobile broadcast solutions, service providers for web design, production of marketing, branding and collateral materials, audience research services. 
And much more ,for more visit -www.aitecafrica.com

description.text: The Healthcare NOVELTY is a platform where Health professionals shape trends in Healthcare by exchanging fresh knowledge to improve public health services and produce social value. As East Africa’s largest platform for structured public health discourse, the NOVELTY helps Health Sector practitioners and communities to freely connect, share knowledge, advance innovations and share great ideas in a formal space. Presenters will challenge you to stretch your thinking boundaries. Featured speakers are building innovation hubs in the region, crowdsourcing humanitarian response, driving policy and using innovative technology to drive health service delivery. They are building medical devices out of broken toys and using boats, motorcycles, and mobile phones to care for people. They are using film and photography to change mindsets, using 3D printers to build prosthetics, visualizing data to make people pay attention, and sharing their ideas, and designs to achieve great milestones in healthcare.

For further inquiries contact Sheila on 254(0) 703 500 814 
Kenya has over 22,000 registered BOSA SACCOs, and 300,000 registered chamas. By the end of 2014, SACCOs had mobilised Kshs 460 Billion in member deposits, projected to grow to Kshs 800 billion by 2022. Many of these SACCOs and chamas are successful at accumulating savings in a bank account, but fail to agree upon an investment strategy amongst the members. Consequently, their savings are in many cases “under Invested”. The Chama & SACCO Investment Summit will provide the following benefits for participants: 1. Provide training for Investment Groups on responsible investment strategies - how to manage an investment portfolio using best practices of diversification and risk management. 2. Expose Chamas and SACCOs to a variety of reputable investment opportunities across the full range of sectors. 3. Provide basic training on the impact of inflation and government policy on investment portfolio performance and how to hedge a portfolio against systemic risk. 
4. Provide training on how to successfully invest in real estate, agriculture, manufacturing, hospitality and other sectors.

description.text:
We are excited to invite you to the upcoming Annual Health Festival scheduled for 27th and 28th Aug 2016 at TRM Mall, Thika Road.   
HEALTH FESTIVAL is an Iris Management annual event that seeks to inspire, educate, and motivate families to a Healthy lifestyle.  
The Health Festival offers something for every age and every interest.  
At the Health Festival you will be: 

Educated
Entertained and 
Empowered to take action or make healthy choices for your family. 

Best of all, the Health festival will connect you with community resources to help you reach your health and wellness goals! 
  
The health festival offers: 
Screenings on: 

Cancer
Diabetes
Blood pressure
Eye Checks
Ear screenings
BMI etc. 

Healthy lifestyle demonstrations e.g.: 

Cooking demonstrations
Food Storage
Healthy foods for school children etc 

Fitness demonstrations: 

Zumba class
Aerobics
Self-defense
Yoga etc.

Seminars on: 

First aid and safety
Breastfeeding classes
Lamaze
Men wellness
Financial Fitness etc.

All activities are inspirational.  
Whether you’re an experienced fitness enthusiast or just beginning your health and wellness journey, the Health Festival is your one-stop shop where you’ll find all the required Products, Services and Information! 
  
The event is free for all online registrations whose Deadline is June 30th 2016 
Ksh 500 per person thereafter! 
            Do not Miss!

Join the hardware and engineering community as we celebrate the 2016 ASME IShow finalists! This Happy Hour will include industry experts and fellow innovators, so this is a great opportunity to build your network and get inspired. Three innovators will take away a share of $50k in cash, and receive a design and engineering review delivered by industry experts. 
We have assembled an amazing group of partners and sponsors to ensure the ISHOW provides the connections, expertise and exposure that hardware innovators need. Each partner brings a unique perspective and unrivaled expertise. We are always looking for awesome people to work with, if you would like to be our partner, reach out.

description.text:
It is land you need, it is land you get! 
Land Investment Expo. This is an exhibition targeting buyers, sellers and developers of land. 
This year, the Land Investments expo will feature a conference to educate the participants on various tenets of the land acquisition process. It is hence primed to share insights of how to identify, search, sell, buy and develop land. 
For one, land ownership is, perhaps, the most ancient expression of wealth. Well then, what does the Land Investments Expo has to offer? This timely and unique event is that brings together people of all walks of life under one roof to make informed choices about land investments. 
It is about finding habitable spaces for human settlement in which to live and work. It is about learning, discovering and enhancing productivity, and developing businesses. 
At this special event the national and county governments will engage with investors on the new dynamics of land ownership, land verification and titling. Potential and prospective land buyers, land selling agents, financiers and SACCOs with land for sale will engage with real estate developers, private Investors and Institutional Investors, corporate firms, hotel owners among other industry players. 
At the expo, county governments will showcase their capacity to sustain various land investment opportunities at the grassroots level. 
We look forward to hosting you at this annual event.

description.text: The Authority, in partnership with capital markets industry stakeholders, is organizing a three day Capital Markets Open Day. The event targets participants from business and professional communities, the County Government as well as the General Public within Nairobi County and its environs. The Open Day’s objective is to create an environment where current and potential investors and Issuers may interact with various capital market Intermediaries and listed companies to receive pertinent information that will assist them to make informed decision while participating in the capital markets industry. The event is also intended to give exhibitors an opportunity to market their products and services to the public.

description.text:
Fee: 500 Ksh or FREE for Community Members.


 


As an entrepreneur at a regular network event you only get a few minutes to introduce yourself and your business and then it is on to the next connection. There is no time to exchange ideas and more advanced business and thought leaders do not come to the events where you go to. Meaningful connections are not easy to encounter. 


 


That's why we created the monthly Business Breakfast: with 19 other entrepreneurs you are invited to exchange experiences and ideas with 3 experienced business and thought leaders. Taking your time, sitting down over breakfast. 


 


For any questions regarding our activities, community membership or to sign up for our newsletter, call 0790 499 022 or mail edward@thehubeastafrica.com.

name.text: Pitch to The Ladykillers: test your business plan!
name.html: Pitch to The Ladykillers: test your business plan!

description.text:
Free Event: 
As an entrepreneur most of the time you spend pitching: to potential customers, partners, investors... you only get one chance to get it right! That is: up to now! Because we intoduce to you The Ladykillers. The Ladykillers are experienced business women and women investors. They have experience sitting in panels and judging ideas as part of pitching competitions.  
If you want to get tested on your business model and strategy, why not pitch and receive brutally honest feedback helping you to take stock of where your business is at. Not as part of a competition, but just in a one-on-one setting because you want to test yourself and get better at sharing your vision.  
Note: at no point in time should you be afraid of sharing your pitch with us; our goal is purely to make you a better entrepreneur and pitcher! As much as we are Killers, we are also Ladies!

name.text: Climate Change Stories on the Streets
name.html: Climate Change Stories on the Streets

description.text:
Green Sun Cities and PAWA254 are hosting groups artists in an event dubbed ‘Climate Change Stories on the Streets’ focusing on using art to communicate climate change message to the public.  
The overall goal of 'Climate Change on the Streets' event is to raise awareness and understanding of climate change, through public forum on stories of climate change to the streets of Nairobi estates.   Our lineup of creative arts display, photography, grafitti, spoken word, musical perfomances aims to engage the public participation in climate change mitigation efforts; You are invited to join us in this totally FREE funfilled and lets address climate change together.

description.text:
Improving Customer Experience Can Help Beat Your Competition, Drive Loyalty and Boost Profits! 
Shift from Customer Satisfaction to Customer Advocacy......Consumers are more educated and less patient than ever, expecting what they want when they want it—and getting it. Armed with search engines and a well-earned sense of entitlement, today’s empowered customers will quickly abandon your company for competitors only a mouse click away. In this fast-changing environment, no company can afford to let their guard down.  
This half day compressed training program gives you the skills you need to communicate professionalism, gain respect, enhance customer relationships and secure an overall competitive advantage through customer experience and service excellence.  
Learn to use the Net Promoter Score (NPS) to Measure Your Customers’ Experiences and Effect Positive Change in Your Organization. Net Promoter is now the worldwide standard for organizations to measure, understand and improve their customer experience. 
What You Will Cover  

Fundamentals of customer experience management
Customer Experience as a business competitive advantage
Customer Experience Management based on Net Promoter Score-Level 1 (The NPS measurement is simply a way to quantify directional performance over a long period of time.)
How customer service creates revenue

How You Will Benefit 

Deliver better, faster service and increase customer satisfaction
Learn how to gain repeat business
Learn how to target the customer experience
Concentrate on changing the high impact points first
Learn how to respond appropriately and assist in quickly finding a workable solution to your customer’s problem

Charges: Special Offer  
KSH 4500/- per participant inclusive of training materials, buffet lunch, refreshments, certificates 
Who Should Attend 
Customer service managers, customer experience professionals, doctors, CEO's, shareholders, account managers, credit and billing specialists, Business owners—as well as managers who want customer experience training in order to reinforce their skills and train their staffs. 
Payment Options:               
We provide 3 payment options, choose one for your convenience, kindly make payments on or before 11th May 2016 in order to secure your seat and be included in the certificate list: 
 1. Mpesa buy goods till number: 909370, 
2.  Direct Bank deposit to the provided Recours Four Kenya Consultants Limited bank details (Available on request) 
3. Invoice: we can send a bill directly to you or your company; applies only if you are employed and will be sponsored by your company.

description.text:
Please join us as we share and display photographs taken over several weeks by children from the Mathare Slums who have participated in a recent Photo Start Workshop held in conjunction with the Mathare Foundation.  
The children, ages 7-14, have been engaged in a course of study that aims to teach photography as a method of self-expression and as an opportunity for social and economic advancement.  
The event is being hosted by the Photo Start foundation in conjunction with the Mathare Foundation. 
 
Link to printable invitation: click here

description.text:
We are pleased to invite you to the Entrepreneurship Digi-connect workshop, powered by Jill Cannon Associates and Technology Artitude, on Friday 27th May 2016,at August 7th Memorial Park, Nairobi CBD. The Entrepreneurship Digi-connect workshop is part of the Jill Cannon Associates’ "Education to Employment" pilot project in East Africa aimed at improving the economic standing youths in the bottom 40% to share in the buildup of their economies, and reduce the unemployment rate. The event is free of charge but registration is required and will offer four parallel activities: 1. A youth's policy brokerage session; 2. An interactive exhibition; 3. Networking Hall; and 4. Startup Kenya Forum The workshop provides a basis for establishing long-lasting productive partnerships and relationships between the youths in the country and their professional counterparts, fostering an exchange of knowledge and mutual understanding of ICT and Entrepreneurship trends and best practices throughout the world. We call upon all major stakeholders in the ICT and Entrepreneurship sectors to join us in finding ways of intensifying and accelerating the exchange of operational information. Further, we invite you to present your products and services at an exhibition stand, and also to take an active part in the workshop, including the possibility of giving various brief presentations. To book an exhibition stand, please get in touch with Ms. Zarita Sharon at the contacts (+254 711 252 870; jillcannonassociates@outlook.com). 
1. A youth's policy brokerage session; The Youths’ policy brokerage session is a major part of EDW 2016 designed to identify new ways to overcome the already existing hindrances to youths’ employment in Kenya. These have been broadly identified as: • Critical skills shortage; • Parallel paradoxes of youths, employers, and education provider • Problems in choosing what to study; and • Finding employment This session will focus on how we can "Innovate, connect and transform" the status on unemployment. 
2. An interactive exhibition; 
This will be a space whose target audience are academics, SMEs, policy makers, Banks, corporate bodies. The exhibition will also encompass ICT and art elements artwork, Artistic representations and abstract artistic creativity. 
During the EDW2016 (Kenya), the interactive exhibition will showcase the best of ICT and digital latest innovations in Kenya. They will be woven around 3 main thematic messages of: 1. Innovate; Focus innovation and creativity; 2. Connect; Focus Kenyan youths and the digital society; 3. Transform; Focus on industry, business, and the digital economy. 
 3. Networking Hall; 
 Beyond informal networking, the workshop will offer a formal networking and information session. Attendance to this will help the Kenyan youths create new, lasting and productive links with other participants with concrete and action-oriented implications: -Meet participants with common or similar topical interests for collaborative relationships; -Listen to the views, perspectives and ideas of other participants; -Share own perspectives in particular policy, innovation or opportunity. 
 4. Startup Kenya Forum 
This is dedicated to start-ups and SMEs, innovators, private and public investors, and policy makers. This forum will give participants a unique opportunity to engage in a fruitful dialogue in innovation ICT, entrepreneurship participants in accelerator activities and create close links between innovators, entrepreneurs, to investors. 
This is an opportunity for Kenyan entrepreneurs and innovators to: -Discover a set of services supporting start-ups; -Create links among the ICT and entrepreneurship constituencies /programs participating in projects on start-ups, entrepreneurs and ICT.

description.text:
In the May edition of #Ed10chat, we get together to vent about all the frustrations that come with pursuing an education in Kenya, from unaffordable fees to lost grades to professors from hell. For instance, how do constraints such as juggling a job, parenthood and education affect you and the society at large? 
Drawing on participants' experiences as well as previous research, we will start mapping the impact of dysfunction within the education system and possibly see some ideas emerge on how to make it all better.

description.text:
INTERCONMACH 2016, International Trade Show on Concrete & Construction Machinery. The exhibition will be held in Conjunction with East Africa Electricity / Kitchen & Bathroom from 18 - 20 October 2016, at Kenyatta International Convention Centre , Nairobi, Kenya. The Exhibition will attract exhibitors from around 15 countries and visitor from East African countries including : Tanzania, Congo, Sudan, Uganda, Rwanda, Botswana etc. 
INTERCONMACH 2016 provides a unique opportunity to expand your business network in one of the most astonishing business destinations in Africa. as Kenya's GDP has raised upto 55.24 from 37.2 Billions with 5 years.. 
Kenya is the hub of East African market and biggest and most advanced economy in east and central Africa, The Country shares borders with Tanzania, South Sudan, Somalia, Uganda and Ethiopia.

name.text: Managing Your Authenticity and Internal and External Perceptions
name.html: Managing Your Authenticity and Internal and External Perceptions

description.text:
Are you eyeing a new or bigger leadership role? Are you unsure of your ability to perform in a new setting; be it a new job or a new role in your organization? Are you looking for new strategies of how to sell your ideas and yourself thereby influencing decision makers? 
  
Then this training is for you! 
  
According Herminia Ibarra, author of Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Leader, a book published from Harvard Business Review Press, “The problem with authenticity is that if you have an overly-simplistic view of it, you may be hindering your own growth,”  
Furthermore, there are several studies that reveal a difference between self-perception (how we think we behave or what we think we are good at) and external-perception (how others perceive our actions). If that difference is significant it can generate considerable problems in how we relate to others at the workplace. 
Fortunately, there are ways of increasing outsight and evolving toward an “adaptively authentic” way of working & leading, but they require a playful frame of mind.  
  
Benefits of this Training 
This training will help you boost your confidence; strengthen your personal impact & professional relationships. You will: 
1.      Gain an objective perspective on how you interact with others at the workplace & how you sell your ideas & yourself. 2.      Learn how to make value based choices by maintaining strict coherence between what you feel & what you say or do. 3.      Learn how to be true to yourself while increasing outsight and evolving toward an adaptively authentic way of working & leading others. 4.      Get an insight on how to challenge your self-limiting beliefs in order to boost your confidence. 5.      Analyze the perception you have of yourself, how others perceive you and how you respond to others. 6.      Learn how social media has an impact on your career growth.  
  
What else will we be doing?  Networking after the event from 12pm – 1pm.  Come mingle with other Nairobi business professionals and get a chance to connect with a diverse crowd made up of leaders in different organizations. 
  
Our Trainer for this program:             
  
Caroline Ngina – Professional Personal Branding Trainer 
  
Who Should Attend This Course 
Senior Management, Managers, anyone who has recently acquired a New Role or a New Job, anyone interested in finding out how to pursue their Career Advancement, and Entrepreneurs. 
  
Charges: 
Advance Tickets: Kshs. 4,500/= 
At the Venue: Kshs. 5,000/= 
Pay through Lipa Na Mpesa Till Number 174570 to reserve your spot before the event. There is a 5% discount on Advance Tickets if paid before 1pm 15th April 2016.     
Charges are inclusive of training materials and high tea.

Then this training is for you!

 

According Herminia Ibarra, author of Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Leader, a book published from Harvard Business Review Press, “The problem with authenticity is that if you have an overly-simplistic view of it, you may be hindering your own growth,” 

Furthermore, there are several studies that reveal a difference between self-perception (how we think we behave or what we think we are good at) and external-perception (how others perceive our actions). If that difference is significant it can generate considerable problems in how we relate to others at the workplace.

Fortunately, there are ways of increasing outsight and evolving toward an “adaptively authentic” way of working & leading, but they require a playful frame of mind. 

 

Benefits of this Training

This training will help you boost your confidence; strengthen your personal impact & professional relationships. You will:

1.      Gain an objective perspective on how you interact with others at the workplace & how you sell your ideas & yourself.
2.      Learn how to make value based choices by maintaining strict coherence between what you feel & what you say or do.
3.      Learn how to be true to yourself while increasing outsight and evolving toward an adaptively authentic way of working & leading others.
4.      Get an insight on how to challenge your self-limiting beliefs in order to boost your confidence.
5.      Analyze the perception you have of yourself, how others perceive you and how you respond to others.
6.      Learn how social media has an impact on your career growth.

 

What else will we be doing?
Networking after the event from 12pm – 1pm.  Come mingle with other Nairobi business professionals and get a chance to connect with a diverse crowd made up of leaders in different organizations.


Our Trainer for this program:            


Caroline Ngina – Professional Personal Branding Trainer

 

Who Should Attend This Course

Senior Management, Managers, anyone who has recently acquired a New Role or a New Job, anyone interested in finding out how to pursue their Career Advancement, and Entrepreneurs.

 

Charges:

Advance Tickets: Kshs. 4,500/=

At the Venue: Kshs. 5,000/=

Pay through Lipa Na Mpesa Till Number 174570 to reserve your spot before the event. There is a 5% discount on Advance Tickets if paid before 1pm 15th April 2016.

Charges are inclusive of training materials and high tea.

Medic East Africa Exhibition & Congress, in its 4th year, is the leading platform for the healthcare industry to do business in East Africa. 
The event is a B2B stage for healthcare professionals designed to stimulate trade and interaction with key government associations, C-level management from hospitals and dealers and distributors from the East Africa region. 
In 2015, more than 2,946 attendees came from 43 countries and in 2016; we are expecting more than 3,500 attendees. 
The 2016 exhibition will accommodate more than 200 companies from 20 countries, showcasing the latest latest advances in healthcare. 
http://www.mediceastafrica.com/en/ExhibitorList/ 
4 CPD accredited conferences will be included alongside the exhibition, and we look forward to welcoming more than 600 delegates and 40 speakers to the congress - designed to provide an outstanding educational programme addressing the latest challenges and best practices in healthcare management and the clinical specialties surgery, anaesthesia, and medical laboratories. 
http://www.mediceastafrica.com/en/Conferences/ 
The 2016 sponsors are Crown Healthcare, Erba Diagnostics, Fuji Kenya, Limited, Hill-Rom, Meditec Systems Ltd, Nairobi X-Ray Supplies Ltd, Philips and Shemay Ltd. 
The event is free-to-attend, click below link to register. http://www.mediceastafrica.com/Forms/VisitorRegistrationForm

description.text:
"I would recommend this course to anyone who is doing pharmacy in a developing country, it opens your eyes and you see pharmacy and supply chain from a different angle” (Cynthia Kamtengeni, Zimbabwe, UNICEF) 
What is the course about? 
According to the constitution of the World Health Organisation’s (WHO) access to essential medicines is part of the right to health. Increasing the availability of essential medicines at the service delivery point is crucial to preventing millions of deaths. The success of a health programme is dependent on the ability to reliably and consistently supply essential products, including medicines, to support service delivery. However, despite increased donor funding and an array of new products, there are a number of factors that continue to significantly restrict access to essential medicines and other health products. 
While many factors influence medicine availability, the capacity of a country’s supply chain to select, forecast, procure, and deliver essential health supplies can be a major constraint. As we move into the post-2015 agenda of Sustainable Development Goals it is clear that sustainable health supply chain management is critical. 
Supply chain excellence requires that all of the functions of a supply chain work together efficiently. For example, decisions about product selection must inform decisions about distribution modes, the frequency of delivery, and storage specification. Similarly, rational use of pharmaceuticals is critical for accurate quantification - which, in turn, effects procurement planning. Any supply chain strategy must consider these interactions and the associated trade-offs between alternative approaches. 
The course structure is based on the 6 + 1 rights of a health supply chain: the right goods, the right quantity, the right cost, the right condition, the right place, the right time, and the right interventions. 
PSA's training focuses on the higher–order skills required by supply chain managers to understand the end-to-end requirements for a sustainable health supply chain, rather than a narrow focus on individual activities. It is, therefore, important for everyone involved in supply chain management to have a demonstrable competence in each function. 
Who should attend this course? 
The training is targeted at people who are responsible for planning, procuring, distributing or monitoring health programme supplies. It will be especially of use to those with a health professional background who are entering the health logistics and supply chain environment. Specific positions may include: 

Procurement officers
Pharmacy managers
Warehouse or distribution managers
Health programme managers
Information systems managers
Staff of Central Medical Stores
Technical Assistance providers
Donors supporting commodity programmes

Language 
The course is offered in English. 
Course Objective 
The objective of this course is to increase participants' understanding of procurement and logistics management of health supply chains and associated planning requirements, enabling them to make improvements in their own geographical and organisational contexts. 
Course Learning Outcomes 
By the conclusion of this course participants will be able to: 

understand the interrelated components of an end-to-end health supply chain from the perspective of a rights-based approach;
describe the critical cross-cutting elements that need to be in place to ensure a sustainable and well-functioning health supply chain;
understand the issues experienced by supply chain personnel from other countries and organisations, and use these to reflect on their own circumstances; and,
apply the experiences and resources identified in this course to make improvements in their own health supply chain based on their area of influence.

Course Content 
Day 1:  Module 1 - Introduction 

Define health supply chain management, the key supply chain functions and stakeholders, in the context of the 6 + 1 rights of supply chain
Describe the difference between ‘access' to and ‘availability' of essential medicines, and the core elements for access
Describe the negative consequences of broken health supply chains
Explore the key attributes of well-functioning health supply chains

Day 2: Module 2 - Right Interventions, Right Products, Right Quantity 

Right Interventions

Explain the ‘umbrella’ of ‘right interventions’, which sets the policy and procedural framework for effective health supply chains
Define rational use of medicines and explain how inappropriate use of health commodities affects health supply chains




Right Products

Explain the role of Essential Medicines Lists in product selection, and the benefits of National Essential Medicine Lists (NEMLs) to public health supply chain management
List the resources available to assist in Medical Devices Needs Assessment before product selection
Determine what makes an effective donation policy and consider barriers to effective implementation




Right Quantity

Understand what is meant by quantification, and the associated key activities
Apply a variety of quantification methods to determine product quantity requirements
Describe how quantification links to subsequent health supply chain management activities
Apply VEN analysis to make the best use of limited financial resources
Explain how emergency situations may change procurement approaches



Day 3: Module 3 - Right Quality, Right Cost 

Right Quality

Describe the differences between quality assurance and quality control in a health supply chain context
List the quality assurance activities used in the procurement cycle, including Good Manufacturing Process (GMP) and pre-qualification
Explain the differences between counterfeit and sub-standard medicines and what steps can be taken to avoid the entry of these products into the marketplace
Describe the use of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to monitor health supply chain performance




Right Cost

List the guiding principles governing public procurement
Explore the different procurement activities from requirement definition to supplier performance management
Understand the importance of procurement planning as a key enabler of an integrated health supply chain



Day 4: Module 4 - Right Place, Right Time 

List the components that make up a logistics and inventory management system
Explore the different logistics and inventory management activities
Describe the key elements of cold chain management
Identify the key principles to follow to ensure appropriate storage of health commodities
Explore the common logistics and inventory management challenges in downstream health supply chains
Identify when reverse logistics may be required and how this should be operationalised

Day 5: Module 5 - Cross-cutting themes 

Describe the importance of supply chain system design and the concepts of integration (horizontal and internal), segmentation and vertical supply chains
Explore risk management in health supply chain activities
Explain the difference between performance monitoring and evaluation activities and identify where these are undertaken throughout the health supply chain cycle
Identify key human resources activities that need to be present to ensure a productive and sustainable supply chain workforce
Describe how innovation approaches should be considered to ensure appropriate integration into the supply chain

Terms and Conditions 
Read Pamela Steele Associates Ltd. terms and conditions.

description.text:
"It was very informative, very well presented and enjoyable. I have learned a lot  of leadership tools that will assist me in my work" (Elrashid Saleh Mahdi, NMSF Sudan) 
Modern leadership is about building the capacity of those around you.  It is about designing organisations that truly engage people and strengthen performance. 
What is the course about? 
PSA provides a space where you can transform the way you think and the level at which you operate. 
Our leadership development programmes will help you to define yourself as a leader and give you the practical skills and knowledge to excel in your role. 
We enable you to develop the skills for authentic leadership through self-awareness, dialogue and collaboration.  We work with you to develop your ability to operate strategically and transform your organisation, adapting to the demands of complex environments and markets. 
If you’re starting out on your leadership journey we support you to build and sustain high performing teams and individual performance.  We offer senior leaders fresh approaches for working positively with power dynamics and organisational conflict. 
Who should attend this course? 
All programmes are designed to meet the needs of: 

Directors who want to discover new ways of thinking about their role.
Senior managers looking to learn from the experiences of other supply chain practitioners.
Those recently promoted and facing significant leadership challenges for the first time.
Aspiring leaders who are keen to take on more responsibility and wider roles.

Course Objectives 
We support organisations to have: 

Self-aware leaders who will improve organisational performance
Staff who are well supported, motivated and take actions that make a significant difference
Cohesive teams that excel in collaborating to deliver outstanding results

Learning Outcomes 
Our programmes are designed to support leaders to: 

Be confident and authentic in supporting others to deliver great results
Create a shared and inspiring vision to drive the organisation forward
Develop cohesive and effective organisational strategies
Lead people through organisational and personal transformation
Inspire their teams to excel in delivering excellence
Flourish in challenging internal and external environments

Course Content 
You can expect us to support you to think differently about how you lead, and challenge you to be pragmatic in making positive changes when you return to your place of work. 
Our dynamic and fresh approach to learning ensures that you will come away from our programmes with renewed enthusiasm and confidence. 
Our open programme covers these broad areas: 

Effective Leadership
Leading Strategy
Leading Change
Leading Others

When we design bespoke programmes for organisations we include those areas of leadership learning to support the unique needs of your people. 
Terms and Conditions 
Read Pamela Steele Associates Ltd. terms and conditions.

name.html: Ethical Hacking & Countermeasures - Bootcamp Style Training

description.text:
Learn it practically from a Lab Environment- Book the CEH exam 
DATE: July 11th- July 15th, 2016(5 days) 
Venue:Sentrim 680 Hotel, Kenyatta Avenue, Nairobi - Kenya.  
FEE: Beginner: USD 250(Plus 16% V.A.T) 
Intermediate: USD 320(Plus 16% V.A.T) 
Advanced: USD 450(Plus 16% V.A.T) 
(Does not include travel & accommodation)  
  
Hosted by: KENVISION TECHNIKS LTD 
  
Ethical Hacking & Countermeasures - Bootcamp-style Training Program 

 

  
  
Course Description 
This is a 5-Day training that is engineered to take the trainee through an interactive environment where they will be shown how to scan, test, hack and secure their own systems. The lab intensive environment gives each student in-depth knowledge and practical experience with the current essential security systems.    
Students will begin by understanding how perimeter defenses work and then be lead into scanning and attacking their own networks, no real network is harmed. Students then learn how intruders escalate privileges and what steps can be taken to secure a system. Students will also learn about Intrusion Detection, Policy Creation, Social Engineering, DDoS Attacks, Buffer Overflows and Virus Creation.

Learn it practically from a Lab Environment- Book the CEH exam

DATE: July 11th- July 15th, 2016(5 days)

Venue:Sentrim 680 Hotel, Kenyatta Avenue, Nairobi - Kenya.

FEE: Beginner: USD 250(Plus 16% V.A.T)

Intermediate: USD 320(Plus 16% V.A.T)

Advanced: USD 450(Plus 16% V.A.T)

(Does not include travel & accommodation)

 

Hosted by: KENVISION TECHNIKS LTD

 

Ethical Hacking & Countermeasures - Bootcamp-style Training Program

 

 

 

Course Description

This is a 5-Day training that is engineered to take the trainee through an interactive environment where they will be shown how to scan, test, hack and secure their own systems. The lab intensive environment gives each student in-depth knowledge and practical experience with the current essential security systems.  

Students will begin by understanding how perimeter defenses work and then be lead into scanning and attacking their own networks, no real network is harmed. Students then learn how intruders escalate privileges and what steps can be taken to secure a system. Students will also learn about Intrusion Detection, Policy Creation, Social Engineering, DDoS Attacks, Buffer Overflows and Virus Creation.



 

 

When a student leaves this intensive 5- day class they will have hands on understanding and experience in Ethical Hacking. This course prepares you for Ethical Hacker Certification.
